review: Went here for my daughters birthday!  The service was just ok, food was not much better!  We had already paid and was sitting for almost 10 min before they finally brought out the birthday dessert.  I had to ask 4 times for a refill on water.  Our table sat finished for almost 15 min before someone came and took some of the stuff.  We asked more then once to get napkins, they never came out so I finally stood in the front of the kitchen to get some.  This place is not getting any better year after year!
The service this time was awful. It wasn't busy but boy was it slow. We waited a very long time. Once we finally got our food, our server hardly came around. The food was good so I gave it 3 stars.
The new Voodoo fries are great! And the drinks were nice and cold. We had pretty good service. The burgers could be a little bit bigger. Great atmosphere.

Not very busy but waited 45 minutes for food, which arrived cold with hot plates as if they were stuck in the microwave. Waitress was very non-attentive, had to ask 4 times for water. One cook came out of the kitchen and was eating food left over from a customer on an empty table, while another waitress affirmed his behavior.

Iam not really excited about my visit there today it was ok, tower of onion rings were AWSOME burger was ok not much flavor, fries got sent back due to they were cold, and having to pay a 20% tip for waitress not doing much I was disappointed , won't be back any time soon, if at all

Always good burgers! We love coming here weekly. Only bad thing I have to say is some of the servers look like they hate their job or something they should fire those girls and get people that actually like their job

Was very disappointed this trip. Normally the burgers are juicy and full of flavor. This time? Well we only eat half our food.  Partners burger they ran out of the items for it without telling us so he ended up with a totally diff burger.  Be a while till we come back I think.

Though I love Red Robin this was not the best experience people who came in a half hour after we did had their order taken and food before we did.   Than we finally got our food it was not even correct I got no lettuce and tomato on my burger when I never asked for it!  To be completely honest I think the waitress forgot to put our order in...the manager did save the day just a little late.

Im not one to complain but the service was horrible! We ordered to go (about 10 of us) and decided to stay last minute well they seated us and never bothered to go back. We called the server and asked for water and no one brought us anything until about 15-20 mins later.
This restaurant has went down hill badly. We had ok food, horrible service . Watched 2 different tables leave because they were not waited on.

Pretty disappointed. We just moved from Seattle area and figured the red robin would be the same. They're so lax and unattentive here, it ruins the experience. We didn't get water until after we were half way through our main course from who we assume was a manager because he noticed us having issues. My husband had an empty beer glass sitting on the table for at least 20 minutes. The food was decent, but the fried shrimp tasted like it came out of a frozen bag. Our beer was stale and flat. We barely got any attention from beginning to end. Took FOREVER just to order drinks. And I'm still sitting here waiting to pay with cash and it's been about 15 minutes.... HELLO RED ROBIN WE ARE HERE TO EAT YOUR FOOD AND PAY FOR IT! Major fail guys.

Our visits here are always awesome. Fats service and great burgers! I love thier tavern burgers. The best. Super juicy. What really stands out tho is the customer service. In the bar area Stephanie with blue eyes is amazing! Never had an empty drink fries were brought out for 2nds was friendly and funny. She gets a 5*   thank u.

We try not to frequent chain restaurants, but sometimes you just want a burger with all kinds of ridiculous stuff on it, so we just decided to go to Red Robin. We got a half stack of onion rings, which were pretty delicious (and piping hot), and then a guacamole burger for me, and a whisky BBQ burger for my husband. I wasn't really into my burger; I wanted something fresh (guacamole, lettuce and tomatoes - sounds good, right?), but the lettuce was all wilted, the tomatoes were grainy, and everything all together just tasted a bit sour. On top of that, the fries were a bit limp.  The server was nice but a bit distracted, which I can understand on a busy weekday night. Still, experiences like this just make me want to try extra hard to find a non-chain establishment next time.

Something rotten sitting at the table... Just had a wonderful lunch good service and good food. Server split an order and was very helpful. Burger was tasty. Fries were hot and milkshake was thick and very good. So why the 2 stars. Well I got ripped off by the new table tablet terminal. Thought we would try a game while waiting and it (there is apparently some fine print somewhere) so we got dinged for $1.99. Now $2 is chump change and we had a nice lunch.... BUT (this for the rocket scientist who set this digital thief up.) I don't  like being ripped off. If there is a fee for a game bring up a dialog box, don't just reach into my pocket. Game was pretty worthless in any case. If they want to encourage use of a terminal using it as a revenue source is not a good plan. TRUST is important. I don't trust Red Robin anymore. So what was the result. for this customer. Well we like Red Robin, and will likely return, but will skip at least one visit because we feel betrayed and deceived. Second, the plan is to save time and labor costs with the table top terminal. Sorry NEVER using the digital thief again. Give a sneaky device my credit card SORRY no way.  So nice meal good service  5 Stars RIPPOFF SNEAK THIEF on table  -3 stars,

Just came in for dinner on a Tuesday night, not in the least busy, long story short, sat forever and no one came to take our order, we just sat there waiting all FIVE of us. Lame. We won't be back, the remodel is nice but the service is garbage.

2nd attempt for to go food as we stay at the next door hotel. They put mayo where asked for none, forgot sides, no napkins or silverware and messed up at least one thing on every item. Obviously no management in the kitchen at all.

Worst red robbin I've been to,  1)they took forever to give us a table. 2)took forever to order our food 3)5 minutes after we got our food the waitress was already bringing the check. That was my braking point like I haven't taken one bite out of my food and your already given me the check and the other thing the waiters and the waitress would not stop staring at them until I gave them a nasty glare.  Worst time of my life

Red Robin used to be a favorite of our family, frequented at least once a month, because of the quick refills, great food and attentive service. All of those things have ceased to be. On this last visit, we had to ask for every refill, twice, we wait over 20 minutes for food, of which the quality has severely diminished, and were charged for an upgrade of fries we did not receive, even though the server assured us that it would be taken off the bill. I told them it was my nephew's birthday, but after waiting for over 10 minutes after our plates had been cleared, and not seeing our server once, we gave up and left. This will be our last visit to this location, unless we see a drastic change in the reviews that are being left, as there are many other restaurants in the Tri-Cities worth our patronage.

We have been to Red Robin on several occasions and have been normally happy with the service, but things have changed with our last couple visits. It appears that the restaurant is under staffed and can't keep up with the demands of the clients. The food tasted decently, but it was hard to get any refills in a timely fashion. The server genuinely tried hard to meet our needs, but she had a large table top that she was trying to manage as well. I wish Red Robin had kept its location in Richland on Geo Way many years ago as it would have a steady steam of clientele especially with all the workers from Hanford. Overall, we only visit Red Robin on special occasions as it is loud, crowded and the service is sub-par.

Should be a 2&1/2 but I don't get that option :(  I really used to like Red Robin. You could count on everything tasting "good". I normally get the avocado burger but decided to go healthy and had the Caesar chicken wrap. It was...a 2&1/2. We purchased fries as an appetizer and had to ask out server for a refill EVERY time. Mostly because they gave us 10 fries at a time. Weird.  Have potatoes suddenly gotten freakishly expensive? Caesar wrap: bland chicken in a tortilla with Caesar dressing. Meh. Had the clam chowder which the server said was "GREAT!". ?? I rarely send food back, this chowder had zero flavor. I found 1 clam and 2 small potato chunks in a runny milk base. I exchanged for chili. A bowl full of hamburger meat in brown sauce. What??  So, needless to say I'll stick to burgers if I return. My hubby had the mushroom burger--which was delicious; hence, 2&1/2 stars

I'm reveiwing for TO GO service. I used the online app to prefer the a1 burger with fries. I picked the 445 slot and i got there at 430 ish and it was done at 445. I ordered my burger with some pink but it was well. For red robin, it was consistent with the red robins have gone to in other states. I was somewhat disappointed that I didn't get a ton of fries-afterall if you eat in house they are bottomless. The burger was good with flavor. Fries were crispy outside and soft in the middle. I would not sit down and eat there, but if you want a burger a step above fast food it's nice yo be able to buy online and pick it up fast. I ordered at 415 for 445 and it was done in that time. The app wouldn't let me schedule 15 minute pick up so keep that in mind when you order to go.

Worst burger meal ever!  Got the lettuce wrapped burger w a side salad.  The salad was mostly the white portion of iceberg lettuce, slightly light brown at the edges.  The visual was completely unappetizing.  The point is that the kitchen should never have let that salad leave the kitchen. Now to the burger.  When I get a lettuce wrapped burger at Five Guys, the flavors are amazing and the burger patty has remarkable flavor for less cost. The burger patty was near tasteless and the toppings did little to help it. Not going back.  Thus is a high volume, not concerned about quality place.  If you need all those sauces and toppings to mask the blandness of the burger, that tells you all you need to know.

I've eaten here about 6 times (business trips and it's next to my usual hotel) and have never had as bad an experience as tonight. Open seating in bar, not too many people, 15min just to get a beer. Finally food came, burger was a mess! I order something new every visit, but this was not appetizing looking. Burger patty was in three separate pieces. Ordered the boss hog - it's got pulled pork! Who wouldn't want that? I got about 2 quarters worth of pork on there - yes, the size of 2 quarters. Haven't even eaten yet, just needed to rant. UPDATE: been battling the oh no's since 1am. Thanks Red Robin, have to call ya out on this one. Dropping stars to 1

Call it bad luck perhaps but To be honest, I have always been a fan of Red Robin, but I have to say, Kennewick is by far the WORST service and the worst lack of common sense. Like I appreciate that they all are working and all have jobs but I have been there 5 times in the last 5 years, and EVERY time, I kid you not EVERY time they have failed on getting my order correct. I don't even order anything special, literally have gotten it wrong. One time, we went with some family from out of town, they wanted to go there, we all ordered, and for whatever reason forgot to put in my families order, our guests had their food, ate before ours came out, just honestly bad... I'll never go to that one again after tonight, we decided to call in and do a pick up order. Well, surprise surprise, they didn't know what no lettuce or tomato meant, the soup we ordered was literally a few tablespoons of broth, wilted Salad, and forgot parts of the order. Total rip off, once again, not too sure what to do, I tried to complain, I have done everything.. they just won't change

The floors needed to be cleaned badly. Waited a long time for a server then the order took a long time to get the wrong food to table. The experience was horrible. The manager did give us our food for free. But, we will never go back to this Red Robin.

Came here on my last day in Kennewick before heading back to Portland. I usually order the Crispy Chicken Burger every single time I go to a Red Robin restaurant....but on that specific day they had a picture of the Sriracha Burger as a special new menu item, so I decided to go with that. I should have known the photo was too good to be true. The burger that came out turned out quite soggy....similar to the quality you would find at a fast food chain. Also, the sriracha burger tasted nothing like sriracha. And that is coming from an Asian girl who uses sriracha daily. I was almost tempted to ask the waitress to give me a squirt of sriracha, or hand over the bottle so I can get the full spicy experience. There was no heat to the burger, which was disappointing. Also, after asking a passing waitress for a fry refill, I didn't end up getting it and had to ask another waitress a while later. Can't say the service is all bad, some waiters/waitresses were very attentive, others....not so much. Service was very spotty

I'll start with we have always loved Red Robin. My kids always want to go here. It is my son's favorite place. We have been to so many different ones a number of times. However, my last experience with this place did not go well. I ordered food for my family to go. When we got home they had not included the dressing for my salad. Annoying but I can deal. As I was looking over my salad the Chicken still had pink on it!!!!! It was not fully cooked. Luckily I always check my chicken now after a bad food poisoning experience a few yrs. ago. However, had I not checked, I would currently most likely be throwing up. Chicken with pink is unacceptable! This is the second time I have had chicken from this place with pink still on it. The first time was a chicken sandwich about 6 months ago. I didn't review at the time and let it go as a one time thing. Now that it has happened twice I feel the need to review. Not acceptable. 1* for my food and only a second star because my son loves this place so much.

Used to be fun to go to Red Robin, now it's become a bit of a let down.  The Kennewick location seems to have very poor service, we were at the RR in Spokane a couple weeks back and service, even though it was crazy busy was very good.  I can't say that about Kennewick.  I could year the table behind us had some issue that the manager had to step i to resolve.  Sitting near the kitchen (ugh!) we could year some of the staff complaining as well.   It drives me nuts when we place our orders and the wait staff that took the order is not the one to bring it, and we're forced to try to claim our food from a clueless food runner.   Wait staff didn't bring all the waters we asked for and only refilled one persons water after she asked.  There was no check in to see if things were cooked properly or if anyone wanted more fries, of course until we were ready to go.  We used to get the orders to go; but after a few bad experiences we've given up.  The last time the sent us out the door with the completely wrong order, but that time they did comp our meal completely. But this shows the lack of detail and attention, again its either understaffed or lack of training. I'm not sure what's going on at the Kennewick store; either understaffed or lack of training. But we've had our last 3 visits end up like this.  It used to be the apple place up the street was the questionable place, but they seemed to have fixed it.  Perhaps its the new minimum wage, but what ever the reason we're not rushing back to this location.  Red Robin also needs to update their menus for those watching things like carbs and calories. I'm shocked that they don't list either throughout and then on some items only calories.  Its time for RR to catch up with other restaurants and provide this for their customers.  Final gripe tonight was the loud "drill" sound.  At first I thought somebody was doing construction at 7PM, then figured it must be a blender.  But it was very constant and annoying. Turns out it's their new machine to blow up balloons.  Bad idea on so many levels.

I came in during a busy lunch and wanted to order food to take-out. I was seated at the bar and attended to quickly. I ordered the poutine fries and some Mac & cheese. They made my food quickly, and the bartender was thorough to include utensils and extra napkins. When I got home and dug in...YUM! Those poutine fries are delicious. I devoured them! Maybe I was getting a little full from the fries, but I wasn't too impressed with the Mac n cheese. I ordered it with bacon, which they forgot to include (also didn't charge me for).  Good lunch, fairly priced, good portion sizes, and prepared it quick!

The Red Robin reputation remain solid at this location... So so Burgers overrated fries slow and unprofessional service... However the service at this location is slower than most.  For your own sanity go with the straight cheeseburger and avoid the sloppy calorie-laden sauces loaded on the other burgers. Skip the Brews here they are way overpriced

I used to really enjoy red Robin, but after today I don't think I'll go to another one. The service was fine but the $15 burger was quite bland and that's just ridiculous considering what I'm paying for it. It appears they have slacked on the quality and the value. It's the second time I've been to this particular Red Robin and I recall the previous experience having a similar outcome as well. There are tons of places to get a burger, I wouldn't recommend this as your go-to.

Sat in the bar. I really disagree with the reviews that the food is horrible. That's BS. Their burgers are great. Service was decent. Beer choice is okay. Plenty of TVs on the bar to enjoy games. Never a bad place to land.

Walked in today at 130pm. Had to wait 5 minutes to get table (not bad). Got to our table and gave our drink order. Waited like 15 minutes and no drinks. Got up and walked out. This is absouluty the worst red robin I've been to. Understaffed and it's been thus way for a while now. I will give red robin a try but not on kennewick.......

The food might be great but the service sucks. We have been here over 60 minutes after being told 30-45.  They seat smaller crowds first and 5 or more wait as others that came in after them are seated. Management should be fired.  Ladt time I will ever recommemd anyone come here.  Not family oriented. Still waiting.

This is the 2 time we have ordered out and been very disappointed. I have ordered the Southwest Sombrero salad. Both time the lettuce has been wilted, water logged, and browning. The salad is suppose to come with jalapeño coins. Both times there has not been any. I thought possibly they had changed the recipe again so clarified salad was suppose to have them. (My favorite part of salad) Once again when we got home the salad was missing them. We also only got a few fries. If ordering out check your order before leaving!
If you love cold fries twice, and onion skin in your burger get here!! This is the last time I will visit Red Robin.  Go elsewhere.  This restaurant is not even close to what it was a few years ago.

We've been going to this Red Robin every other week for about four years.  The service has definitely varied across those years, and we've definitely sent some food back.  But most of the time we have great service, and great food!  :)

Dear Red Robin, Your restaurant is a drag.  No matter where I go, it's the same. A drag. First, your greeter was very nice and said "you can sit at a tall table in the bar!" to which I agreed.  She then shoved a menu in my hand and pointed to where the table was. Ok, whatever. Lazy greeter. Then, I sit for ten minutes with some waiter guy walking by me no less than 15 times, and not even making eye contact.  Clearly, I don't exist.  No problem! I'll change this. Next, I decide I'm hungry and thirsty, and not willing to let this obviously lousy waiter ruin my night.  The bar now looks good, so I sit there.  The bartender immediately helps me...there is hope! Then, after 15 minutes, I get my lousy burger on a dirty plate.  Oddly, the key ingredient to this pineapple burger is missing--the pineapple!  I mention it to the bartender, and she immediately orders another and apologizes.  The garlic fries, so proudly advertised on the menu ARE A SCAM--don't do it; these are simply the normal fries, with a bunch of Parmesan cheese dumped on top with garlic salt?  Yeah, they suck.  They were also old, cold, and bland. Boo. And, then there is the kitchen.  This place is disgusting.  Don't do it.  It's a salmonella disaster waiting to happen.  Look around, look closely. Touch the menu, touch your table.  Now, go wash your hands. One star is for the bartender, who at least did her job.  Other than that, zero stars.  I rarely encounter a Red Robin that can get it right anymore...too bad! Good bye Red Robin! And good night.

Food was terrible. Burger was so dry, my sons patty melt was horrible. I let the waitress know it was my daughters 10th birthday. She chose this location for her birthday dinner and what a disappointment... no song... nothing. She brought my check and never returned to our table.
Daughter bit into chicken strip and center was raw. They credited $5 to our tab. Management did nothing.
The restaurant was dirty outside and in. Our waitress was horrible and we didn't get the correct dinner that was ordered.

Stopped in after four hours of driving from Tacoma. Was greeted to a friendly environment. My server and bartender Samantha was super sweet and helpful in helping me choose with brain being fried. Ordered the blta and some wings and a drink. Enjoyed every bit of it. Great location in this chain.

Wow has this place changed. Took my family here the other night... The remodel is terrible! Looks like McDonalds inside now. The staff did not give a friendly greeting... just said, "what's your name?" We waited a long time and then left... especially after reading the other negative reviews here on Yelp. When I got to work Monday, my co-worker told me of her family's terrible experience, which involved her husband having to go get his own pitcher of water to pour for their table and silverware because the staff was totally inept. Wow.  Sad to see such a great place go down the tubes like this. I only refrained from giving one star because we left before eating.

The food was horrible. We ordered an appetizer as well (fried pickles) not only were they tiny but they looked like a side you order from the dollar menu at a fast food chain. Be cautious with the tablets there is a "entertainment fee" if used. Which no one cared to mention. You'll see it on your receipt after the fact. The service isn't any better. Every employee seemed miserable. I'm not sure where they were all hiding to be honest. We will not be returning. This place has gone down hill. I do want to say thank you for the balloons! That is the only good thing Red Robin has left to offer these days... I take that back. Second thing they have to offer are their chicken strips. Not bad. And to the young man at the front of the restaurant teasing my 4 year old because he was wearing an Angels hat. Grow up. You should ask to work in the back of the house so you don't represent your employer in such a negative way. Even my 4 year old gave you a look wondering why a grown adult was acting so childish and unprofessional. Go Angels! P.S. Our server was great no complaints there. Wish I remembered his name.

Pretty disappointed in Red Robbin's service and food today. Sat in bar seating and had to ask to be served. Servers were extremely slow and the appetizer came after our actual lunch. Not only was the food slow but the lunch I was served didn't include all the ingredients is said it did on the menu. Super bummed because it used to be a place I loved to have lunch. Wouldn't recommend this Red Robbin location.

I'm completely shocked. We went into Red Robin today in hopes of sitting out on the patio and enjoying this incredible sun. Asked the host up front, who was extremely rude, stated that you have to be 21+ to sit outside now! My sister who is 13 wasn't aloud to be out there with us. WHAT!?!?! I've always had terrible service and the food has always tasted mediocre-at-best but this?...makes no sense whatsoever and you have now offically lost all my business.

Their food is pretty consistent and we have yet to have bad service. That's saying something because when I first moved here in 2007, husband's parents wanted to meet up here what seemed like every other week! Yes, some is better than others but overall no bad experiences. Biggest downside is how crazy busy they get, just like most of the chain places around town. Even on a Tuesday night it can be crazy busy! I love their french onion soup and for me I can never go wrong putting an egg on a burger. I want to love their "finest" burgers and the times we had them in Tennessee they were good, but here the "smoke and pepper" ketchup had very little smoke or pepper flavor. I do like the buns for these burgers a lot more though. Husband tried the southern charm burger at our last stop. The onions were great but the bacon is supposed to be candied and was decidedly not. Don't get me wrong, that might be the right call but we were both curious to try it out as advertised. But that doesn't override the overall good experiences we've had.

Normally restaurants cook ground beef well done unless otherwise requested, and provide warnings for those who wish to consume it undercooked. If I ever decide to visit this establishment again, I'll never order To Go so I have a chance to send back the food. When I ordered, I didn't request special doneness, assuming this implied I wanted it fully cooked (as it should be.) Despite a helpful notation on my ticket that read "NO PINK-175", the patty was only slightly warmed and fully pink all the way through. Here's to hoping I don't start puking in a few hours.
Lousy service. Small, hard, and dry fries. Waitress didn't even fill up our water once. She seemed put off when I asked for silverware and napkins.
They have improved quality and speed now.  I recommend eating at the bar area I'd you want your drinks fast and want to avoid screaming kids

Last Friday, my company, server, fries, drinks, and protein-style ghost pepper burger were amazing.  Less amazing was the three days of life that were forcibly extracted from my life like so much juice through the masticating machinations of fate.  Migraines, terrible body aches, chills, and violent simultaneous expulsions from both ends of my body punctuated my journey to enlightenment.   All things in life are temporary, and if this hell can pass, so too can all others, though I am less certain about my new-found pathological inclination toward hand-washing and complete loss of appetite, but I do have hope.  The food would have been worth the journey to the restaurant, but not the spiritual journey it has since ushered me through.  Would not recommend.
Food was good service was great! But for god's sake turn the lights down. We sat in the bar and it felt like a kids birthday party was about to crack off.
Awful service, burger was mediocre. Broccoli was clearly microwaved. We will not return.
Worst service for take out orders!! Mixed up my credit card with someone else! No apologies ! Nice job Ryan !
Very bad service , waitress and staff talking back in the kitchen . Messed up my order , asked for ketchup and they brought me an empty bottle. Food wasn't too bad, but I want decent service.

I must start with I am a Red Robin Fan, love the burgers, bottomless fries etc. That said....  The store here in Kennewick is terrible, maybe to be generous miss, miss hit and then miss some more Tonight was a 'test' i was really hoping that the service had improved  NOT...  I went in, waited while the party ahead of us was seated (2 hostess's, no acknowledgement that I was there) until finally one of them said she'd be back in a minute..  She was, and we were seated...  then the wait began.... We waited, we read the menu, we waited, we watched the manager deal with the poor service issues at the table behind us TWICE..  we were ignored..  After 10 minutes I'd had enough and we walked out. This poor service kills me...  Great restaurant chain, great idea,,,  Just REALLY POOR SERVICE AT THIS STORE.....

Bopped over to this Red Robin, at Happy Hour, being we were staying in the hotel next door.  $3.00 margaritas on the rocks, decent for the price, I think the hh margarita was better than the regular silver patron signature drink I had after hh. Food was great, service was excellent, Mary is the best!

I spent my entire trip in Tri-Cities ripping chain restaurants only to end up at a chain restaurant. Yeah, yeah, I know. But it's Red Robin (YUM!) and I like their fries. Give me a break. I have to give the server I had some recognition cause she was amazing. I forgot her name, so this will be a general recognition for any woman who works at the Red Robin. Thank you for liking your job. It makes a difference. Now, on to the food. For me, the usual chicken teriyaki sandwich dripping in its own juices. Fries of course. For my co-worker, a healthy less drippy turkey burger. Both were delicious as always. Just don't pay attention to the calories and you'll be fine. Beers were also cold and delicious. Sometimes it worth being a hypocrite, especially when there are steak fries involved. So, if you want to join me, try this Red Robin and leave with a smile.

Really disappointed in the service. My husband and I came out on a Wednesday night (11/12/14), was fairly busy, but got seated right away, and then we sat for 15+ min. No waitress, no drink order, no menus. Nothing.  And then we left. I informed the hostess that we've been sitting for awhile with no waitress and she just stared at me dumbfounded.  I love Red Robins burgers, but we will likely never go there again. :/ On another note, we tweeted about it, and tagged Red Robin (not a local twitter account), and they responded within 30 min to my tweet (not my husbands) and got my information and said that someone would be in touch. They did, and gave me a $15 red robin card, and said my experience was being sent to the store and regional people, but it's not something that money can fix.

We've been to Red Robin a hundred times, but tonight was special. Four of us walked right in and sat right down at around 515 pm.  Immediately, our server, Olivia, walked over and asked what we would like to drink. She came back shortly with our drinks and took our orders. She misheard my daughter, so when I looked at our order, it was wrong. She apologized and changed the order. The whole meal, she brought us drink refills before we asked and reloaded our fries without us having to ask. I would sit in Olivia's section if you get the chance.

Food poisoning every time I get a burger here I don't think it's a coincidence anymore also peers of mine have also gotten sick from the burgers here I don't think things are very sanitary in this restaurant save your health and chose a different burger restaurant

Tonight my husband and I brought our four kids in for dinner. It was in the middle of a crazy dinner rush and our ticket got lost. We want you to know that it is human to make mistakes. It happens to the best of us! I've been there before and it's ok!! We want to thank the staff for being so courteous to us. Our waitress Savannah was fantastic! It's not the end of the world for my children to learn to be patient and gracious to others! Plus their patience was rewarded with a free tower of donuts!! They thought the ticket getting lost was awesome!!

My husband and I went back to this Red Robin after being contacted by Red Robin and being sent a $20 gift card.  The server we had, named Dillon was excellent!!! No complains at all.  This was definitely the type of experience I'm used to having at other locations.

Arrived at 4:20 and have to wait to be seated in a booth as they don't have enough waitstaff present to open more booths.  This far into the season you would think they would have extra staff scheduled for the Tuesday promotion crowds. At 4:25 we were seated, but not in the open booth. We were seated in the table with the half booth half chairs. At 4:30 our server Jordan came by to welcome us and take our drink orders. We inquired after the open booth and he said the server for that spot wasn't here yet. He offered to move us and be our server, but we opted to stay instead of creating a problem for the servers. At 4:35 he took our food order. We received drink refills at 5:02 with our food delivered immediately after. At 5:15 we asked for and received a dessert menu. At 5:20 we ordered desserts. Dessert arrived at 5:23...delicious! We received our bill and paid at 5:33pm. All in all a good evening.

My wife and I have eaten at Red Robins throughout the Northwest in the past several years. We recently moved back to the Kennewick area, so have chosen to visit Red Robin because of their consistency. We went there yesterday and after waiting for quite awhile, our food arrived. I asked if there was a problem in the kitchen. Our waiter stated that she forgot to put the order in. I told her that we come to Red Robin because they have usually been prompt with the service and the food has been good. She must have told the manager because he came over, apologized and adjusted our bill. We will probably give them another chance. If we get the same treatment next time, I will definitely talk to the manager. They need to know if they have a problem.

This particular Red Robin restaurant needs some help. The staff is undisciplined, the dining area was anything but clean. Cob webs on the light fixtures, glass doors heavily smeared with hand prints, there were seven empty tables with dirty dishes stacked when we were seated. There was refuse containers overfilled and trash on the floor.. There were 2 waitresses and the manager standing by kitchen area talking about anything other than work. When we finished our sub-par burgers there were still two out of the seven tables left with dishes.  There were only 6 customers so the staff wasn't busy. We were seated at a table and requested a booth. The staff member seating us looked at the dirty tables  and stated "there's nothing I can do about that" The food was luke-warm indicating it sat for a period of time while the staff discussed personal business. The milk shake we ordered was brought to the table by a young man that was wearing thick blue rubber gloves. Like the dishwasher would use, I did not see the kitchen area so I cannot fairly review its condition.  I would not recommend this restaurant for anything but new management.

After a day of flying and seeing clients, it was getting a bit late for my usual mom and pop places so I settled for corporate food. In my mind the thought was, the good thing about corporate food like Red Robin is that it is the same everywhere, I was so wrong. Walked in, waited to be seated....not too long, good, just wanted to sit and relax. Server came and took my order for a tasty beverage and since I was already decided took my order for the PRIME RIB DIP... Tender prime rib topped with caramelized onions, horseradish sauce and Provolone cheese on a rustic baguette with au jus for dippin'. Served with a side of coleslaw and Bottomless Steak Fries. That is how it Is presented presented (taken from the on line menu.) Sounds pretty darn good even now. What I was presented with would not have made the grade on the worst roach coach you have ever been unfortunate to eat from. Over view: it was COLD. From the bottomless fries to the rustic baguette to the fixings, the meat,  onions, the cheese was not even melted.  Only thing that made room temperature was the cole slaw. I actually watched the half cup of au jus congeal before my eyes. (It was actually moving in the cup)  I have eaten at several Red Robin restaurants across  country and just have to let this Red Robin know that the meal they tried to serve me was by FAR the worst ever offered. Now, I enjoy food and enjoy cooking food, this would not pass for food in  nastiest of places. Get your act together Red Robin in Kennewick

Red Robin, why not. Just grab a burger and a beer. Sat at the bar. Everything was good, not the best but it did the job. Had the A1 peppercorn burger with mushrooms. Burger was a little charred and dry. The beer was cold and refreshing on the hot day.

Alright. I've come to the conclusion that this place can be great, but it can also be pretty awful. I've had times where I've had excellent food and service, great food but poor service, mediocre food and good service, and mediocre food and bad service. I guess it depends on who's working. Our server was great today and the food was pretty good, too.  Seems like we took a long break from eating here after our last experience with an older lady server who left us waiting for 15 minutes after we were done eating before bringing our check. Meanwhile, we watched her refilling the straws and going into the back room several times, so she wasn't even waiting on another table. The real kicker was that after she remembered us, she apologized and said she forgot us, but she took another 10 minutes to run our card and bring our receipt. We left SO frustrated.  The lesson to be learned here: be weary of the old lady servers. To be safe, if you're in a hurry, go somewhere else.

Every single time my wife, son and I done at this location, every aspect of the dining experience progressively gets worse. We had lunch at this location today (28Feb2016) and it was absolutely horrible. I've served in multiple restaurants and understand off days. But EVERY SINGLE TIME? The last 5 or 6 times we ate here, with hopes of it getting better, we are thoroughly disappointed. Appetizers ALWAYS come out after entrees, servers rarely check in, if at all, apologies are completely half-assed and we almost always end up being over charged or charged for something we shouldn't have. I've been patient when coming back, giving them chance after chance, but enough is enough. This particular store needs a complete overhaul on attitude, customer service and taking pride in their jobs. Granted, it's most definitely not all the staff, but the 4 or 5 servers that we've had, some multiple times, need a new outlook at how to be a server and their role in the dining atmosphere.

This is a really bad location. I've had consistently slooooooowwwwww and horribly inattentive service. Usually, Red Robin is reliable but at this location the food has been below average and just not good at all. I've given it a couple tries and just can't do it anymore,  too many other good places to eat around here!

Food was cold and soggy....even the so called "bottomless" fries.  Table was dirty and the floors were even worse.  Will probably never go back to another Red Robin again.  Very disappointed as my kids chose this for dinner for a special occasion.  Disgusting.

The last two visits,  the food and service was horrible.  After taking forever to be seated,  the food also took forever to come out after ordering.  The worst part - I only had one bite of my cooler than room temperature burger and asked to just have it removed from the bill and just charge me for the fries.  At this point,  I didn't want to wait another 30 minutes to get my food while my wife and daughter were already finished.  The only reason I give two stars is because this place used to be good.

Food was good, what I would expect from any Red Robin. They had the gluten free menu which included gluten free buns which my kids love. They also fry their fries in a dedicated fryer but you have to ask. Service was okay, not the fastest but it seemed a little busy. The only reason they don't get a higher rating is because the bathrooms were grrrross. That's all I have to say about that.
Pretty disappointed. Forgot our appetizer, when they brought our food there was only six whole French fries on my wife's plate. Do I need to say more?

First Red Robin I've ever been to, even though there's one near my home in Texas. This place impressed me enough to try the one back home.  Great burgers ( had the Bleu Ribbon,  returned for the avacado burger), waitress was great.  Full bar, too.

This place is total chaos. ----------------------------------- edited to add: And the food is really just ok. Better than you'd expect from your average mega chain, but still nothing I'd prefer to live off of on the regular. It's hard to taste or smell the food, however, when your other senses (vision and auditory) overwhelmed by the barrage of chaos around you.

So it's my birthday and want to take the family to dinner.  Was on my way to Fire pizza n decide to hang a left instead and hit Red Robin... BIG mistake.  15 min wait... no worries, but now we go to the dining room where I have seen school cafeterias with more room. The tables are packed in so tight I had to get up twice to let wait staff and customers by.  But I'm not even sure we had a table.  I have been to resteraunts all over the world and NEVER been asked to sit at a table that rocked, wobbled, and so annoying.  Ya was offered to change tables after we complained and then I tried to fix the table, "we can get you a new table, will only be a 10-15 min wait."  No one should ever be seated at a table like this!  It shouldn't even be in a resteraunt.  I will give props to the waitress.  She did her best to manage in a terribe atmosphere.    But the food was substandard at best.  For a place that prides itself in burgers they should not be dry, and for the love of all that's holy give a blue cheese burger some blue cheese.  Give the wraps some actual meat, and there should not be more batter than fish.  But the beer was cold and the fries were warm.  Guess they have that going for em.  What they don't have is any more of my money or business.  Too many other options for much better food where yiu wont be treated like cattle on a rocking boat at sea.

Always said Red Robin was my favorite until last couple of months .services and wait time has gotten worse. Hamburger is thin and dry and  we both got in tim can 4 fries in one and 6 in the other. Food does not taste as good and no garlic fries. My biggest draw in going there. The dried stuff is gross.

Have to say the last couple of times we ate here the service has went down.  Appetizers forgotten and delivered with meals cold, malts taste like plain shakes (servers should go to Carl's Jr. to see what a real malt is), our table forgotten between server change over, and manager who didn't seem to care and nevers follows up.  It will be awhile before I return.
I had a Horrible meal here. Dry & burned chicken sandwich and soggy salad. Server was good. Just my opinion.

As I have stated in previous reviews for this Red Robin location, I've loved this Red Robin location for decades, but lately it has gone downhill.  After a particularly bad visit, I left a one star review stating that I was done.  Red Robin contacted me and offered me a gift card to go back and try again.  I was skeptical, but my wife and I went and gave it another try.  The visit was slightly above average and since then we have been back a few times and the experiences have been okay.  That ended tonight.  We had another horrible experience tonight with a condescending manager and the wrong food being brought out several times.  We could hear the kitchen staff arguing with the servers and managers.  We will not be back.  Please do not contact me about this, Red Robin, there is nothing you could do to get me and my family back as customers.  If you need more context about previous visits - good and bad - see my previous reviews.  I cannot recommend this Red Robin location to anyone.

Although there is a recent onslaught of better burgers in this area we still flock here. A beer or cocktail and kids birthday parties always go together in a public environment. Then there is the brass, and red decor and picture on the wall that represent their American heritage or love of locality. But the fact is the staff is young, has a high turnover and in our case were all getting stoned out back that night. So they brought us other people food, never returned to table for a recheck, and was told 4 times "yes I would like fry sauce"! But then the loser of the night, the why the hell are you here part the cherry on top! Along came out bill and no birthday surprise for our child. But who says anything you have endured all the bad service one could at the not getting food on you  level yet. So you promise the kid a DQ treat and stiff the stoned waitress. I mean they will have a new one next week anyway. If your still eating at RR you most likely are young and still have fond memories of dad chasing you around the Resturant as a birthday child and it not because he was so gleeful! Sorry, it because he was over served booze then got stoned out back with the staff. Red Robin plays on our senses and we fall for it because to them we are predictable.
The food is good, but the service is awful. They constantly under staff and crowd everyone in the waiting area. When you finally are seated it's slow serving.

Long wait time with disorganized front end staff.  After a 30 minute wait the staff kept telling us we were next, then they would take three other groups first. The staff was rude and completely unorganized.   HUGE DISSAPOINTMENT.

I've been here many times and have never had a negative experience. The food is good. I love how all red robins are the exact same so I know I'm getting the same thing every time. It gets busy, but most red robins do.

I am sad to say I did not enjoy my food here. Which is sad because my family has always loved burgers from this place. The garlic fries I got lacked the garlic and were simply steak fries with Parmesan. It was embarrassing to taste and eat.  Chicken tortilla soup was delicious however I was very disappointed when my sister's bf found a dead fly in his salad. Lucky the waiter was on top of it and so quick to fix the problem and not charge us for the salad. My sister who's salad was fly-free did not enjoy it however because of the change in their salads. What used to be a big bowl of chopped greens was now some sort of romaine wrap that they were trying to say was a salad. This new salad is considerably smaller than their old salads and less flavorful. I am giving this place 3 stars solely on service of our waiter Jordan. Who was not only on top of the fly incident but was on top of our food, bottomless drinks, and was always very kind and courteous!
When ever I go here I always leave satisfied. There is always a seat open at the bar. A large cool glass of Irish Death beer. I recommend The Burnin Love burger. It is amazing.

Dined there yesterday. I ordered the French dip. The sandwich arrived on cold, dry bread that tasted stale. The waiter, who did a great job, offered to have the cook prepare another sandwich. I accepted. Second sandwich was as bad as the first. I definitely don't recommend you try this item.

Waited 30 min at 16:30 on a Saturday for a table for 6 even though there were tables open .  Had to beg for napkins, silverware, and plates for our appetizers. Food was cold when it arrived.  This place has been on a slow and steady decline. Oh yeah they do not have Guinness on tap even thought they advertise it. Not too impressed.

What has happened to this Red Robin?? Twice now ( I did not learn the first time) my hamburger AND fries have been served COLD. I mean NO warmth at all. I refuse to watch my husband eat while I wait for a new burger to be cooked so the waitress took my order off of the bill. I left hungry. I have heard similar complaints from friends. I hope this RR can improve itself soon.

This is the first time I've ever been to Red Robin.   Server was really nice. I expected the food to be nothing special and it was.  French fries were good but the chicken in my BBQ wrap was shitty processed meat.  I know, I asked for it.  Maybe I should try the "famous" burger next time?   1 - star for the server, 1- star for the fries.
Great service. Great food. Ordered protein style and sweet potato fries. Loved it. Now I know where to go whenever I come for a business trip.
Our server, Sam, was great. The beer selection sucks.  We ordered burgers with no pink, and mine was raw.

the Whiskey River burger and fries is really good I get it every time I have gone here to eat the milk shakes and beer is really good. we always get the tower of onion rings. my boyfriend gets the blue cheese burger and we have never been disappointed with the food yet always been really good and filling. the service is good and usually they are pretty busy place but we have never had a long wait. I would recommend this place to eat at if you haven't you wont be disappointed. I have yet and been going there for a long time.

Yum yum...great service thanks ! SCREAMIN RED ZOMBIE DELISH! GUAC BA CON. BURGER SPLIT BETWEEN 2 adults...appetizers fried mushrooms & zucchini where fabulous....the first time weve enjoyed coming to red robin anywhere,!!

The food is usually decent, though the big turn off for me is usually the service. I have been to this location several times and each time I wonder why I bothered coming back. The wait staff isn't particularly friendly, and the wait times are long even when you're the first person in the door. Waited 20 mins to get the check, than once I had it decided after the waitress didn't come back to take our card we would head to the front. She promptly came running (maybe she thought we were ducking out, though given the two kids and the size of my mom purse it seems unlikely). I paid and she didn't even bother to say thank you hope you have a nice day, or thanks for coming it. Though I usually feel obligated to leave a decent tip this place is just asking for you to leave NONE. If you've got hungry kids, and you're in any kind of hurry steer clear of this Red Robin.

Let me say this upfront, I am not a fan of Red Robin to start with.  It's a chain restaurant that tries to be your favorite burger joint; but that's pointless because who doesn't have a better favorite burger joint already?!  If you must eat at a national chain restaurant, eat at Chilis or - God forbid - Applebees (their new "All-In Burgers" are actually damn good!).  That all being said, this particular Red Robin only has one thing going for it: it's in the parking lot of the hotel we stayed at.  This place looks like it used to be a 50's themed diner about 20 years ago and over the last 20 years it was bought and rebought, themed and rethemed, and none of the previous decorations or themes were ever removed.  There are a TON of noisy kids running around the place playing with balloons.  There is a small game room for older kids.  There's a weirdly placed "bar" that butts up against tightly squeezed chairs with a bar rail for a table.  There are more tables in the dining area than booths and there is no feel of privacy whatsoever.  Our waitress was super busy, inattentive, and never came back to check on us until it was time to pay our check.  My wife and I actually wanted to have another beer, but she never came back.  We finished our less than impressive food, paid the bill, and left.

Was unimpressed with the service tonight, I waited 20 minutes for silverware. Was happy that I could switch out red meat for a vegan alternative. The salad was great (it's hard not to be). They made sure to remove the cheese and gave me dressing to the side so I could dress it to my own liking and I appreciated that. I probably will not return unless I decide to eat red meat

Usually find Red Robin to have tasty and great selections however on our way thru Kennewick we chose to stop and have an early dinner.  I ordered the Chicken Ensenada.  The chicken was way overcooked in a mess of something like pure salt!  Tried to scrape off the brown goo so I could eat it.  Still could not eat it!  When the waitress came to see if we were done eating I told her she should tell the cook that the chicken was so salty I could not eat it!  She asked me if I was ready to have my plate taken!  She took my plate with no acknowledgment of the uneaten chicken or even "sorry"!  The bill came with the full price bill for something that was inedible!  I guess I should have marched back to the kitchen and told them to fix another plate!

My husband and I were seated after a 25 min wait which thats what you expect for a busy weekend. We were seated and the waitress was all over us ready to take our order. We had to get our kids situated and ask them what they wanted. So she came back a couple times before we were ready. My husband and I split the Spicy Chicken Avacado Wrap. It was amazing. I will be back for more of that goodness.
Excellent service and food!! If you looking for fast, yet delicious food. RED ROBIN is the go to place. I got the cookie magic and Burnin' love burger. Yummy ;-D
Brought the wrong food and the wrong drinks. Slow service. Just not too impressed with this place.

Tasty burgers (the Bonsai is my favorite) but they do A LOT of different things. Our waitress was stretched a bit thin, with tables inside and outside (like us) so the tea-glasses were empty more than I would have liked.  But overall, it was pretty good and what we've come to expect from this chain. I'm glad to see that they offer lower-carb options now, like sweet-potato fries and lettuce-wrapped burgers.    I'm sure we'll eat here again, the next time we're in the area.

As others have mentioned, this restaurant is packed at peak times, and as such, is pretty noisy.  There always seem to be a ton of birthdays, too, with servers grouping up to clap and chant.  If you want to be seated within a reasonable amount of time and be able to hear yourself think/hear the people you're with talk, avoid said times.  Otherwise, this place is pretty good.  I never seem to have a bad server, bottomless fries are good, and the house brand seasoning goes well both on the burgers and the fries. As for specific menu items, I love the freckled lemonade here.  They seem to get the balance of lemon and strawberry just perfect, and adding sliced strawberries to the drink is a nice touch.  Being bottomless, I always seem to have 3-4 of these per sitting.  It's like fruity crack in a glass.  The burgers, in my opinion, are just OK (I actually like Applebees burgers better), but the aforementioned house brand seasoning helps considerably. Overall, I'd say it's nothing particularly special, but a perfect place to go when you have a hankering for a burger and fries that are better than your average fast food.
I eat here 3 or 4 times a year. It is a fun environment and the food is pretty good. Not the best food, but certainly not bad. Okay, a fun date is to go and just share a Mile High Mud Pie.

We've gone here a couple times as a place we feel comfortable taking the kids. As mentioned in other reviews, the atmosphere is very loud. The staff is kid-friendly and they have some gluten-free options for our middle kid. As far as mega-chains go, I feel the food quality is better than, say, Applebee's or Chili's. It is difficult to make healthy choices at this restaurant, however.

One nice thing about this restaurant is knowing that you will get a good meal. Red Robin is consistent, which I appreciate. I had the southwest chicken salad, huge portion for a big guy like me with awesome flavor!

If you like restaurants that are ready-made punchlines for just about any joke, fly on over to Red Robin in Kennewickity likity split. "Why am I so fat?"      "Red Robin."           (roaring laughter) "Who else should I invite to our wedding?"      "Red Robin."           (knee-slapping cackling) "Why are all my arteries clogged with Crisco?"      (...you get the point) Red Robin keeps in tradition with most American family restaurants, like Applebee's, O'Charley's, and Chili's.   There are few surprises here.  You know what you're going to get the minute you walk through the door.  In my opinion, it's an Applebee's with better lighting, more kids, and occasionally some guy in a giant bird costume wandering from table to table. The atmosphere is fun if you're looking for generic ambiance, babies crying, and oversized menus.  Now is a good time to mention that I hate oversized, laminated menus.  They're always greasy.  And did I mention the giant bird flapping from table to table? "Happy anniversary, honey. Want a picture with the bird?" The menu is a hybrid of Applebee's and Chili's, without a real signature item.  I usually stick with the bleu ribbon burger (always just a tad undercooked than I requested) or the whiskey river bbq chicken wrap.  While the burgers are generally tasty, they're far from being "the world's greatest gourmet burgers" as the restaurant brags. Alcohol takes up a sizable portion of the kong-size menu.  A giant neon sign boasts of  "the world's most masterful mixologists."  Ahem.  Hardly.  If you can stand the embarrassment of ordering a drink called "sand in your shorts" or "fruity boozie daiquiri," you'll likely be impressed at their appearance.  They also offer a decent selection of eye-catching nonalcoholic frozen favorites. In case you're wondering, the giant bird is not wearing shorts.  Is that some sort of health code violation? As you might guess, blue jeans, shorts, and dirty t-shirts are the normal attire here. "Excuse me, sir?  Just because you're using a napkin doesn't mean you're not still picking your nose." Don't take anyone here to impress them.  Take them here because you feel comfortable around them, or want a loud atmosphere where no one can hear her sobbing. I'm probably being too hard on the place.  I eat there often.  I prefer it over Applebee's.  They have decent burgers.  The service is usually above average.  Their steak fries are bottomless and very good. As long as you're in the mood for a chain restaurant atmosphere, you'll have fun. But don't be surprised when you visit the bathroom and find a giant bird taking a dump in stall #1. Let's hope he washes his hands before returning to work.

Just a dang good burger.  Not sure how it is that other restaurants can't quite get what they have.   The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is that I get a little sticker shock every time I go in...but a darn good burger for sure. Be sure to check out the Blue (or Bleu?) Ribbon Burger.

Usually get the Natural Burger so I thought Id be a little adventurous this time. Got the Bruchetta Chicken Burger. It was pretty bomb, I would definitely order this again. The bruchetta, petso aoli and balsamic cream really came together well. The ciabatta bread was a nice touch too rather than some tired 'ol bun. They come with some (bottomless) "parmesan fries" which are supposed to be better. Or something. Now I know fries are not health food but damn, they were so oily and greasy I just couldn't do it. Id grow another chin if I ate those. I sent them back and got some regular fries and then all was well in the world.

Red Robin has been a place we've gone to every year for my children's birthday dinner. We went last night, and were pleased only half the parking lot was full. When we walked in, we already saw two separate parties waiting. I looked around the restaurant and saw that it was half empty. I asked the hostess how long the wait would be, and she said 15-20 minutes! When we were seated, Edith was our waitress. She was not pleasant, at all. We told her it was my son's birthday so they would sing happy birthday to him. We got our food after waiting FOREVER (which, none of our plates tasted good). I reminded her 4 times that my children still hadn't gotten their drinks. They were finished with their meals and ready to go by the time she brought them, and she didn't even apologize. Honestly, that simple word would have changed everything. Instead she treated us like we were a bother. We didn't even wait after that to see if she remembered about my son's birthday, we immediately got up and left. The first thing my husband said to me was "we are boycotting Red Robin." I'm sorry, but the service was terrible, and we will find a new restaurant for our birthday dinners.

We eat here about once a month, and it's your basic Red Robin. Nothing great, nothing horrible. The other day, however, the waitress (Teke? Tete? something like that) was very rude. She was friendly enough (though slow for refills, and never checked back after she dropped food), but got very defensive and rude when we pointed out that our order was slightly wrong. We had two kids at our table who ordered the mac n'cheese from the kids' menu and I had requested their refill come out at the same time as their food (because she'd been so slow). Instead of two dishes and two refills, she brought two dishes, and one refill bowl and tried to serve both baskets (with sides) to one kid, and the plain bowl to the other kid (without his side), claiming it was "a double portion anyway," so we were getting "the same amount." I'm sorry, but we weren't concerned about the amount...we were concerned that you brought the order out wrong and expected us to just deal with it. Yes, I could have split up the "double portion" bowl you let the kitchen pass off to you, but we were paying to eat there, we should not have to do that. It seems petty writing it down, but seriously, her attitude over my questioning it was uncalled for. She also refilled my son's water with Sprite before bringing the food out and never did come back to check if everything was ok after the food came. Not impressed.

I'm really impressed with their Vegetarian Burger...It was great...I can't remember the name of it now...I just wish they had more Vegetarian/Vegan options on the menu but its a Ok 'go to' if you are with other people who aren't Vegan/Vegetarian.

The experience we had in the afternoon of August 29, 2013 was my absolute worst ever experience in this Red Robin. My niece reviewed this earlier about the horrible service we received for a party of 7 with 3 children.  We were ignored when we were seated.  No one came and gave us water or drinks.  We had no silverware. After about 5 minutes or so the waitress finally came by to tell us she would "be right with us".  She left and we didn't see her again for another 5 minutes or perhaps longer.  When we came there was just one other couple and our party in this side (the bar side) of the restaurant.  A few minutes later, 6 men were seated and were served drinks and food before we were.  Other people came in and had drinks before us too.  Finally she came and took our drink orders and we asked for the bottomless fries.  She was snarky and pretty much said not a chance. They brought our drink orders and finally took our food orders.  When we finally got our food we asked for condiments and silverware.  The gal said sure but NEVER came back!  We waited at least another 5 minutes before the original waitress came back and we asked again.  I was shocked to see that the condiments and silverware were within a few steps behind the counter! As for the food:  The spaghetti two of the kids ordered had huge bowls of noodles but only a tablespoon or so of sauce, the noodles on the bottom were sticking together and impossible for the child next to me to pry apart - inedible. The vegetables on the hamburgers were wilted and nasty.  My hamburger tasted a little fishy - like they hadn't cleaned the grill in some time.  By the time we finally got the condiments and silverware, all the food was cold or barely warm. My brother-in-law received a different burger than he ordered and he said that was "gross".  When the manager came by, I brought up the problems we had to him.  He told me there was nothing he could do about that, and that there was an ongoing battle in the kitchen going on over the fries.  However, I happened to look up and see him yelling at the waitress in full view of the patrons in the other dining room and clearly from my vantage point facing the kitchen.  If that wasn't shocking enough, the poor waitress came back and proceeded to tell us that it wasn't her fault, she was a very good waitress with 20 years of experience and the poor gal began to cry.  The waitress and the manager never apologized, but instead pointed fingers at everyone else.  Whatever the overall problem is, it simply isn't worth it to go there and spend good money for food that is far worse and slower than anything I can prepare at home

Was a good place to go eat. I'm on a business trip and went and sat at the bar. Food was good, beer was even better. They have a Oktoberfest beer in right now.  Only two complaints. Bar could have been wiped off a little better. It was a little sticky and dirty.  My last complaint is to the bar tender. Yes they were extremely busy but the bartender had the worst attitude. Pushed some of his co workers and did nothing but whine and cry about managers not helping him. Well bud, looks like you took the job, so sack up and get it done.  Other than that I enjoyed the food and beer.

I enjoy red robin, good food and nice atmosphere. This location is hit and miss though. Went there about 9 on a weeknight and place was pretty slow, ordered the riblets and chicken which was pretty good flavor wise but the food was only warm as if it was sitting for a bit but not gonna complain about that much. Our waitress was more concerned with doing end of night duties instead of taking care of us properly, had to ask bus boy for silverware, I hate speaking up for things like that or seeing her elsewhere and getting her attention for pop or fry refills... At the end of the night she was so eager to get us to pay and finish up but worse was the fact that she asked twice if we wanted change back from cash! I understand she was hoping for a tip but it's very distasteful on her part, my friend paid with bills in order to get rid of some $1s and just get a $10 back. So our waitress gave her a $5 and five $1s back.... How rude. Was planning on leaving a bigger tip up until that point. In my opinion it's better to hit up these places when there busier, for some reason it's a better experience. Or it might just have been our waitress who was in such a hurry to close shop for the night and expect a large tip for subpar service. 3 stars for food 1 star for selfish waitress.
You'd have better luck with the Six-Dollar burger at Carl's Jr. across the street. Pass on this place.

As chain restaurants go the Kennewick Red Robin is pretty good. The food has always been alright, never stellar. The staff is always very friendly and never lets your freckled lemon-aid/coffee empty. Great place to eat with friends. Tends to be a bit loud, but everyone seems happy so there's a light mood.
Red Robin is high end fast food for better and worse. Fast, excellent service, predictable good food but loaded with salt and fat and few veggie options.

The decor is bright and colorful like Applebees. The wait staff is friendly and energetic. Decent selection of "Brews" to go with your meal. Many hamburger choices are on the menu. Also various chicken "burger" selections are offered. Various wraps and salads are also listed. Majority of the menu selections are served in plastic baskets with fries.
Its soo hard to finish one of these sandwiches but they are soo worth every penny. Even all you can eat french fries, nice family atmosphere, and the service is pretty fast and fun.  Yeah, I'm a fan.

The big mac and whopper are more flavorful than the burger I ate here.  The burger I had was something like a bbq burger of some sort.  There were two problems with my burger. One, I could barely taste the bbq sauce.  Two, there were onion rings on it!  I don't remember the description saying it came with them.  This lil' addition made the burger taste dry.  I don't know what the attraction is to the restaurant.

I went here with my family for Sunday lunch.  We were seated right away as we must have made it there right before the "after church" rush.  I had to ask for a children's menu (my daughter is almost 2), but that's not the fault of the service staff as the other person in our party got there before us and said we didn't need one, only a high chair.  But I love getting my daughter the crayons so she has something to do while we are sitting and talking.  Our server was very nice and was quick to accommodate us for our drinks...I asked if they had Cherry Coke, they didn't but she said she could put some grenadine syrup in it.  Surprisingly better than cherry coke I must say.  We ordered an appetizer of onion rings and cheese sticks, the onion rings were a little over done, but the cheese sticks were delectable.  I ordered the Guacamole Bacon burger as I was craving bacon and avacado for some weird reason.  My husband ordered a bacon cheese burger with an extra burger patty with two kinds of cheese, got the mac and cheese for the little one, and our cousin got a teriyaki burger with a pinapple ring on it.  All were pretty good, but there were so little fries in my basket.  I asked for more, and was given another basket only 1/4 of the way filled, but they were piping HOT so that was a plus.  My burger was a little dry and there was hardly any guaqamole on it.  And the bacon wasn't crispy, kind of rubbery, but I ate it anyway.  It tasted pretty good, but maybe it sat in the window an extra couple minutes before it was served?  I ate 1/2 of my burger and took the rest home. My daughter loved the mac and cheese and my husband ate 1/2 of his burger.  The plus was that all of us took home the rest of our burgers and ate them for dinner.  Red Robin is a good place to eat, but for 3 of us and a child, I think $50 is a little expensive for the quality of food we got.  The service was excellent, but being an experienced server in the past, it really is about the service and the food.  Too bad the food didn't match up with the service, thus giving this place only 3 stars this time.  I will be back though.  I love the atmosphere there and the wait staff is usually top notch.  Hopefully next time, we will get better burgers.

one of my favorite chain restaurants in town. Yes its loud but that is ok. I can deal with it. Waits at dinner can be long, but it is well worth the wait. Their food is just so good. The best burgers in town, I love the Bruchetta burger and garlic fries. the drinks for the most part are good. BUT I had a mai tai recently and it was just all alcohol and not drinkable. YUK! Otherwise everything is just too good. Daughter loves the whiskey river bbcue wrap. Sometimes it is really hard to pick a good burger as there are so many.

I should have known from the start that this would be a tale of woe. My husband and I had to run to the Tri-Cities (an hour drive from our home) to run a few errands and as we were semi-kid free decided to go to Red Robin for an early dinner. We arrived and there were endless empty tables (good sign, quick service, right?). After about a 10 minute wait we were taken to our seat and told our server would be right with us. A 10 minutes of seating we had our drinks arrive. First of all, my husband was given a diet soda, not a horrible offense, except that he is allergic to aspartame and it gives him horrific headaches. When we ordered our dinner we ordered a couple of sides for our 18 month old and we asked if we could get them right away (thawed fruit salad and precooked Mac and cheese reheated, not difficult). It was at least 15 minutes before those items arrived. My husband and I continued to wait for our orders of buffalo clucks and fries.    It was eeking ever closer to the 45 minute mark in the restaurant (remember it wasn't that busy) when our order came out. My first bite of chicken was cold like straight out of the refrigerator cold. I stuck my finger in the other pieces and the others were barely warm. My husband's chicken was the same as mine. Add to that approximately 8 stubby, mushy cold fries and that, my friends is when we sent it bak to the kitchen. And then we waited, and waited. Just as we got up to leave the manager brought out our food. Too late, we were on our way out. She offered to box it up for us (not the easiest things to eat in the car and we live about an hour from the Red Robin). She offered to comp us (good) but we only had about $5 worth of stuff. We told her what happened and she said the first round had probably be pre-fired and reheated before sent out (remember they were not busy when we got there). Ewww! She also said when our food was sent back it wasn't red tagged (I assume that means expedited,) so she didn't know there was a problem. She offered to give us a gift card, which she did. We were grumpy, hungry and wasted more than an hour of a limited time we had to go out and spend time together. And, to top it all off, the bite of cold chicken didn't "sit well" and I barely made it home. So, all in all, I have a $25 gift card to a restaurant I have no desire to go back to and food poisoning to cap off the night. Thanks Red Robin!
Good burgers, good atmosphere, can't go wrong. Also, for the vegetarians, you can substitute a vegie patty for any burger.

I'm surprised that this restaurant only has an average rating of 3 stars, I love coming to Red Robin and the food and service has always been great and they're prompt about getting our drinks filled and they're also customer friendly, it can be a little loud and busy at times but it is a fun place to go with family and friends
Great service, great food and great prices. This isnthe best place in town for kids!

I don't eat out often, but when I do its usually because we have a gift card, and that was the case today.  The food is good, nothing amazing but good.  Our server was nice, friendly and accommodating.  So all in all a 4 star meal.  When our bill came and we tried to pay with our gift card the server came back and said their internet was down and couldn't take the gift card.  Out of curiosity I called to get a balance on it to see if it was worth pressing the issue.  It was worth 3/4 of our bill so I figured I would ask her to try again.  She graciously said she would try again.  I saw her grab another employee who turned out to be the manager.  She walked back to our table a little later with the cash value of our gift card and informed us that the manager was able to do something for us even though their gift card processor was down.  The manager came over and apologized for the wait, which in my mind he did not need to do.  That is why they get 5 stars, Red Robin has been great to me and my family and I will be back.
